intro: Roettlera cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf roettlera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with three to five lobes, giving it a distinctive, heart-shaped appearance. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Roettlera cordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
